Class SQLReadWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLReadWriter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLRemoteWriter

    public class SQLReadWriter
extends java.lang.Object

    SQL Read/Writer

    The SQLReadWriter Class contains methods for establishing a connection to an SQL Database, reading data from the table, and writing data to it. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the Article class, and thus has methods that work with Article Objects to write their data to the relevant tables.
    Since:
    16 April 2018
    Author:
    Aaron Wile, Chrissa LaPorte, Oriel Francis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SQLReadWriter(java.lang.String databaseName, java.lang.String databaseAddress)
      The SQLReadWriter Constructor accepts a String argument for the SQL Database Name and Address, and initializes the respective fields with those arguments.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addArticleTopic(Article article, java.lang.String tableName)
      The addArticleTopic method allows you to amend the topic field of an existing SQL Table Row (representing an Article)
      void connect()
      The connect method establishes a connection to a local SQL database based on the current databaseAddress field.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getMatches(Article article, java.lang.String tableName)
      The getMatches method accepts an Article Object argument and runs an SQL query for matches on its title and description, returning an ArrayList of article IDs that scored appropriate matches from the SQL query.
      java.util.ArrayList<Article> readArticles(java.lang.String tableName)
      The readArticle method reads a line from the SQL Database table and returns an Article object with fields initialized to the data from the table.
      void writeArticle(Article article, java.lang.String tableName)
      The writeArticle method accepts an Article Object argument and writes its data to the database, accepting a String argument for the SQL table name.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLReadWriter

        public SQLReadWriter(java.lang.String databaseName,
                     java.lang.String databaseAddress)
        The SQLReadWriter Constructor accepts a String argument for the SQL Database Name and Address, and initializes the respective fields with those arguments. It also instantiates a Connection object with the connect method, and initializes the connectionCounter field to 0.
        Parameters:
        databaseName - A String containing the SQL Database's name.
        databaseAddress - A String containing the SQL Database's address.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
        The connect method establishes a connection to a local SQL database based on the current databaseAddress field. It closes any open connection and reinstantiates a SQL Connection object, assigning it to the sqlConnection field.

      • readArticles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Article> readArticles(java.lang.String tableName)
        The readArticle method reads a line from the SQL Database table and returns an Article object with fields initialized to the data from the table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - A String containing the name of the SQL Table
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Article Objects representing the articles from the table.

      • getMatches

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getMatches(Article article,
                                                         java.lang.String tableName)
        The getMatches method accepts an Article Object argument and runs an SQL query for matches on its title and description, returning an ArrayList of article IDs that scored appropriate matches from the SQL query.
        Parameters:
        article - An Article Object to compare against the Database for matches
        tableName - The name of the SQL Table to Query
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Article IDs that were matched with the Article parameter.

      • writeArticle

        public void writeArticle(Article article,
                         java.lang.String tableName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        The writeArticle method accepts an Article Object argument and writes its data to the database, accepting a String argument for the SQL table name.
        Parameters:
        article - An Article Object to write to the database
        tableName - A String containing the name of the SQL table to write to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addArticleTopic

        public void addArticleTopic(Article article,
                            java.lang.String tableName)
        The addArticleTopic method allows you to amend the topic field of an existing SQL Table Row (representing an Article)
        Parameters:
        article - An Article object to read the topic field from.
        tableName - Name of the table in the database
